de.polygonal.ds.BitVector

type
class
implements
Hashable

An array data structure that compactly stores individual bits (Boolean values).

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(size : Int)

Creates a bit-vector capable of storing a total of size bits.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

Instance Methods

inline bucketSize() : Int

The total number of 32-bit integers allocated for storing the bits. 1

inline capacity() : Int

The exact number of bits that the bit-vector can store. 1

clone() : BitVector

Creates a copy of this bit vector. n

inline clr(i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Sets the bit at index i to 0. 1

inline clrAll() : Void

Sets all bits in the bit-vector to 0. n

inline clrRange(min : Int, max : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError min out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError max out of range (debug only). n
Clears all bits in the range [min, max). This is faster than clearing individual bits by using the clr method.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying the array storing the bits. 1

inline getBucketAt(i : Int) : Int

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i out of range (debug only).
Returns the bucket at index i.
A bucket is a 32-bit integer for storing the bit flags.

inline getBuckets(output : Array<Int>) : Int

returns
the total number of buckets.
Writes all buckets to output. A bucket is a 32-bit integer for storing the bit flags.

inline has(i : Int) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns true if the bit at index i is 1. 1

inline ofBool(i : Int, cond : Bool) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only) (debug only).
Sets the bit at index i to 1 if cond is true or clears the bit at index i if cond is false. 1

ofBytes(bytes : haxe.io.BytesData, ?bigEndian : Bool) : Void

parameters
bigEndian the input byte order (default is little endian)
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError input is null (debug only).
Copies the bits from bytes into this bit vector.
The bit-vector is resized to the size of bytes. n

resize(x : Int) : Void

Resizes the bit-vector to x bits.
Preserves existing values if the new size > old size. n

inline set(i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Sets the bit at index i to 1. 1

inline setAll() : Void

Sets all bits in the bit-vector to 1. n

inline setRange(min : Int, max : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError min out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError max out of range (debug only). n
Sets all bits in the range [min, max). This is faster than setting individual bits by using the set method.

inline size() : Int

The total number of bits set to 1. n

toBytes(?bigEndian : Bool) : haxe.io.BytesData

parameters
bigEndian the byte order (default is little endian)
Writes the data in this bit-vector to a byte array.
The number of bytes equals bucketSize() * 4 and the number of bits equals capacity(). n

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var bv = new de.polygonal.ds.BitVector(40);
	  for (i in 0...bv.capacity()) {
	      if (i & 1 == 0) {
	          bv.set(i);
	      }
	  }
	  trace(bv);
	  {BitVector, set/all: 20/40}
	  |<
	    0 -> b01010101010101010101010101010101
	    1 -> b00000000000000000000000001010101
	  >|
